data.description:
ENGAGE is a metaverse platform designed for professionals, event organizers, and corporations to build their own virtual worlds to provide metaverse services directly to their own clients and to build out new business models.  
 
Used extensively for virtual events, corporate communications, education, and training ENGAGE is used by clients such as KPMG US, Stanford University, Lenovo, HTC, KIA, and many other Fortune 500 companies globally to help make their virtual metaverse strategies a reality.  
 
ENGAGE “Link” is our publicly explorable persistent metaverse location where you can visit and socialize with other professionals and visit client-made metaverse locations to attend meetups, events, training days, and even full-length concerts. Our initial virtual world locations include Enterprise Plaza, Education Plaza, Creative Plaza, and Central Plaza for general meetups.  
 
Our enterprise and PLUS users receive additional features such as the ability to run private events, media streaming capabilities, access to our spatial recording features, and full access to our content development tools to build out immersive content quickly and easily which can be shared publicly or privately within your own organization. Coming soon all enterprise and plus users will also receive their own private metaverse apartment where they can invite friends and co-workers over to enjoy movies or experience immersive content together. 

Don’t just talk Metaverse - ENGAGE!

changelog.change_log:
NEW

Metatraversal
- Added the ability to create portals to partnered metaverse applications on Meta Quest headsets. If you want to add inter-app travel between your application and ENGAGE, please contact sales@engageplc.com.

Persistent Sessions
- Added an option for hosts to restrict access to a persistent Session so that only members of the owning group can join.

Mixed Reality
- Added a mixed reality passthrough window on Meta Quest headsets that users can position in any Session and shows a view of their surrounding physical environment.


IMPROVED

Security and performance
- Added an ENGAGE prefix to the file name of downloaded 2FA recovery codes so that they are easier to identify.
- Implemented multiple error messages to communicate the different reasons why someone who used the Remember Me option must log in again.

Sessions
- Implemented a maximum password length of 16 characters.

Mixed reality
- Added an icon to a user's name tag to indicate when they are in mixed reality mode.

Voice communication
- Upgraded the voice communication service.


FIXED

Avatars
- Fixed an issue where if a user entered away mode, the Away tag obscured icons in the name tag.
- Fixed an issue that could cause an avatar's name tag to be incorrectly placed.
- Fixed an issue that could cause multiple avatars to occupy the same seat.

Account creation
- Fixed an issue where if a user didn't enter a username at account creation, the resulting error message incorrectly referenced the last name field.

Localization
- Added translations to some unlocalized areas of the application.

Meta headsets
- Fixed the ability to perform a search from the address bar of the in-session web browser. 

Cloud File Manager
- Fixed an issue that prevented users from being able to load video files that were uploaded before the v3.6 release.
- Fixed an issue that prevented users from being able to copy a sequence file to Cloud File Manager immediately after they saved it to their device in the Content Editor.

Content Editor
- Fixed an issue where if keyframes were added to an IFX and then deleted, a user could not reposition the IFX until after they added another keyframe.
- Fixed an issue that prevented the deletion of keyframes.
- Fixed an issue that could cause keys at the location of the playhead to be deleted instead of only the keys that were selected.

VR headsets
- Fixed the title of the virtual keyboard when a user enters their password to view their 2FA recovery codes.

IFX
- Fixed an issue that reverted object bubbles to appear on hover instead of on selection.
- Fixed issues with filter settings in the IFX library so that applied tags are always visible, and the removal of tags immediately updates search results.

Mixed reality
- Fixed an issue where if a user changed from MR mode to VR mode, thumb controls could cause their avatar to rotate around a point other than the center of their body.
- Fixed the playback of a demonstration video for Location Anchor placement on Meta Quest 3 and Quest Pro headsets.

Connections
- Fixed an issue that could cause a user who is not logged in to show with an online status.

Menu
- Fixed an issue that could cause some menu screens to appear blank.

Security and performance
- Added a specific error message to communicate when a user is logged out of the ENGAGE application due to inactivity.

Deep links
- Fixed deep links to correctly open the intended Session or Event.

Sticky notes
- Fixed an issue where locked sticky notes could still be moved.
